newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia gets 41 more landing rights in Indonesia.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia gets 41 more landing rights in Indonesia.

text.p: Malaysia has obtained 41 additional landing rights to various destinations in Indonesia with immediate effect, Transport Minister Ling Liong Sik said on Friday.

Eleven of the landing rights are for Kuala Lumpur-Jakarta flights, 14 for Kuala Lumpur-Denpasar flights, seven for Kuala Lumpur-Surabaya flights and nine for Kuala Lumpur-Penang-Medan flights, Ling was quoted as saying by the national Bernama news agency.
"The granting of additional flights is proof of the close ties between the two countries and will definitely lead to enhanced rapport between the people of both countries," he told a news conference.
The agreements were reached during talks between officials of both countries in Bali last week, he said.
Malaysia Airlines currently operates 12 Kuala Lumpur-Jakarta flights, seven Kuala Lumpur-Denpasar flights, 20 Kuala Lumpur-Penang-Medan flights and nine Kuala Lumpur-Surabaya flights weekly.

"We also agreed to the open skies system for cargo flights between Kuala Lumpur and Batam," Ling said, adding that joint cargo services between Kuala Lumpur and Surabaya would also be offered by cargo airlines of both countries.
